page.title: 10NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY:History
page.content:
The origional motive power was provided by two Hudswell-Clarke {locomotives}built in 1918 for the Italian War Campaign. Not very satisfactory in service they were quickly replaced by ex_War Department armoured petrol locomotives.
Locos of a similar type built by Motor-Rail at their Simplex works in Bedford remained in service thereafter. The machines within the quarries were 20 horsepower, those on the Light Railway were 40 hp.
The Railway Company was a private company with individual quarries being shareholders. In 1963 Arnolds bought out the other firms.
At its peak the railway carried 3000 tons a week over 4 miles of track.
